captions.text:
Narrator: The early 21st century was a time
of spectacular innovation. It was also when

everything went wrong, horribly, horribly
wrong. Humanity was watched by a vast, cool,

and unsympathetic surveillance system, every
single thing people did online scrutinized

and studied by corporations and government
agencies, fodder for the new pool

of big data, available to the highest bidder.
The human race allowed it, in return for their

convenient, shiny digital toys. After all,
they could always log off. They could log

off whenever they wanted. Then the Internet
of computers and phones grew into the Internet

of things and then a web of horrors.
It started gradually, with cameras tracking

people's every move. Street lamps turned into
surveillance devices, following every step,

recognizing faces, recognizing secrets. Before
they knew it, even appliances knew all their

owners' secrets.
Refrigerator: I made your beer extra cold, Carrie, just like you like it.
Narrator: There was no logging off. The things

were everywhere, and there was no place to
hide from the sensors.

Bathroom: Looks like it is time to visit the
proctologist, Carrie.

Narrator: What of the data? The endless, dark
avalanche of data, available to every police

department, every agency, or anyone willing
to pay for it. The absence of controls and

regulations gave government and corporations
a chance to have their way with the data.

As the last semblance of privacy receded from
the world, the data took on a life of its own.

Privacy disregarded, humans found themselves
forced to choose between technology and their liberty.
Robot: Based on our biometric analysis of

your shower habits, Carrie, we find an 83.739-percent
probability of future antisocial behavior.

Prepare for social-threat neutralization.
Carrie: (Screams)

Narrator: You see, my dear friends, the true
monster of your worst nightmares may not be

a vampire or a zombie or a werewolf. It may
be the shiny metal object you're watching this video on.
Slide Says: Data Captured.  Subjects image has been recorded while watching entertaining video.
We Don't have to choose between liberty and technology. Join the fight at ACLU.org

comments.author: Pamela Tracy

comments.text:
TripAdvisor, Facebook, Yelp, etc. are often miss-used for corporate 
propaganda and not to represent the voice of the people in a balanced and 
fair manner. They are highly monitored, controlled, reviews are constantly 
managed, censored, removed; mostly in favor of the business or company 
represented. Reviews that are and sound too good to be true are really 
advertisement that is paid for or posted by businesses themselves. Reviews 
are also bought from companies and firms that sell profiles made to look 
like customer's experiences to boost their rating, sell their products or 
services and create a completely false image that is inaccurate, highly 
doctored and deceptive. In fact they are mostly just interested in 
collecting your data and selling it, or use it for targeted advertising 
purposes, which is how they make money off your back. That is where the 
value truly lies for them. Don't play along. Fight fire with fire!﻿

comments.text:
Fine commical video.  People need to know that it's intended to be about a 
very serious issue though.  If people see this video and aren't first 
informed that it isn't just entertainment for children, f.e., then they 
might think that that basically is all this video is for; for those who 
don't realize that the intent behind the video is to remind and awaken 
people about a very serious issue anyway.  Maybe some of those people could 
guess on their own what the intent is behind this video, but I suspect that 
plenty of people would just treat it as yet another cartoon for 
entertaining children.﻿

comments.author: Ebony Utley

comments.text:
In America, there's no need to ever have state checkpoints to see citizen 
papers like they did in Nazi Germany, because today, we have our digital 
devices that can be tracked at all times.

I called 911 some time back because a driver was swerving at other 
vehicles. *The operator told me where I was located on the road.* *"You're 
nearing the intersection of 522 and 172nd Street, is that correct?*

I was surprised, because I had my cell data service turned off and my wifi 
was off as well. They were still able to pin point my location.

#datasnatchers #google #digitaldevices #trackingus #nsa #apple 
#privacyrights﻿
comments.author: jb hann

comments.text:
+Fiasco Linguini, I see your point with 911 being able to locate callers 
locations in order to help them, but, our government has proven many times 
over that it abuses and intentionally takes advantage of today's technology 
to be used against the citizens.

All we need to do is look at the practices of the NSA to see the massive 
amount of data that is being collected on American citizens. We are being 
tracked in so many ways that is is criminal. Then we have to account for 
all the other agencies, corporations and other organizations that mine and 
collect our data and our whereabouts, such as the police, Google, Apple, 
CIA, FBI, ATT, BOA, Verizon, Amazon and many more.

As citizens, we shouldn't give up any of our rights in order to receive a 
little security, because we only forfeit both when we do.
comments.author: jb hann

comments.text:
911 is the only organization that should be able to pinpoint you, because 
that saves lives. It's when corporations do it for profit that bothers me. 
Same goes for other government agencies that have no true need to know, 
under the false pretense of national security. Both must be strictly 
regulated, made transparent, and held accountable. That is the proper 
function of government.
comments.author: Fiasco Linguini

comments.text:
Great video!! This video tells it like it really is, in this present day 
and age. The average person has been turned into a Zombie by the use of so 
much technology. People are running their lives based on subconscious, 
pre-programmed impulses that have been placed there subliminally by 
mainstream media, educational (indoctrination) systems, ad infinitum.

When humanity finally becomes full conscious (neo-cortex rather than using 
the R-complex portion of their brains) and snaps out of their hypnotic 
trance, then they will be able to see the world, and the psychopaths that 
have been controlling it and humanity, for what it really is.

Yes, a global awakening among the asleep masses of people, is inevitable. 
How long it will take is another question. The real question is... will the 
global awakening of humanity be too late?﻿

comments.author: Awakened2Truth

comments.text:
Invasion of the Data Snatchers

Data snatchers?? They are NOT science fiction. And they’re closer than you 
think.

New technologies are making it easier for private companies and the 
government to learn about everything we do - in our homes, in our cars, in 
stores, and within our communities. As they collect vast amounts of data 
about us, things are getting truly spooky!

Our video might make you laugh, but a future without any privacy is just 
scary.

Isn't it time we regained control over our personal information?﻿
